## Public Member Functions

### AdvanceCycle() {#a7941cd9d835501582ba89f8352863bba}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void GCNHazardRecognizer::AdvanceCycle ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
AdvanceCycle - This callback is invoked whenever the next top-down instruction to be scheduled cannot issue in the current cycle, either because of latency or resource conflicts.

This should increment the internal state of the hazard recognizer so that previously &quot;Hazard&quot; instructions will now not be hazards.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-h/#l00149">149</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-h">GCNHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00412">412</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-cpp">GCNHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### atIssueLimit() {#af88156b7343529b71f1f9eca67805251}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::GCNHazardRecognizer::atIssueLimit () const"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
atIssueLimit - Return true if no more instructions may be issued in this cycle.

FIXME: remove this once MachineScheduler is the only client.

### getHazardType() {#ad798e3928656e87abcacbf5f7dd47dbe}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ScheduleHazardRecognizer::HazardType GCNHazardRecognizer::getHazardType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;, int Stalls)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getHazardType - Return the hazard type of emitting this node.

There are three possible results. Either:
<ul>
<li>NoHazard: it is legal to issue this instruction on this cycle.</li>
<li>Hazard: issuing this instruction would stall the machine. If some other instruction is available, issue it first.</li>
<li>NoopHazard: issuing this instruction would break the program. If some other instruction can be issued, do so, otherwise issue a noop.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-h/#l00145">145</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-h">GCNHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00190">190</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-cpp">GCNHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### checkMFMAPadding() {#a4ad87b82e14deb07a81035f2ad992858}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int GCNHazardRecognizer::checkMFMAPadding (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42; MI)</>}>
Pad the latency between neighboring MFMA instructions with s&#95;nops.

The percentage of wait states to fill with s&#95;nops is specified by the command line option &#39;-amdgpu-mfma-padding-ratio&#39;.

For example, with &#39;-amdgpu-mfma-padding-ratio=100&#39;:

2 pass MFMA instructions have a latency of 2 wait states. Therefore, a &#39;S&#95;NOP 1&#39; will be added between sequential MFMA instructions.

V&#95;MFMA&#95;F32&#95;4X4X1F32 V&#95;MFMA&#95;F32&#95;4X4X1F32 --&gt; V&#95;MFMA&#95;F32&#95;4X4X1F32 S&#95;NOP 1 V&#95;MFMA&#95;F32&#95;4X4X1F32

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-h/#l00134">134</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-h">GCNHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l02066">2066</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnhazardrecognizer-cpp">GCNHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Private Member Attributes

### ClauseDefs {#ace0f92e6a4212fcf0f2a8110e5a8bddd}

<MemberDefinition
